items.title: I don't understand how to submit
items.body:
I spent $150 on this course and the submission process is by far the most confusing part so far.
I have a windows 10, and from what I'm reading I can't use submit50 without a virtual Linux running on my system?
I just want credit for my work, is there really no simpler way to do so?
and if not can someone describe how to submit this code without acting like everyone reading it is a 20 year coder?
This is frustrating.

items.title: blacklist sensitive dot directories
items.body:
Even though it might be a bit inelegant, probably best to blacklist dirs like

* `~/.ssh`
* `~/.c9`

from being submitted (unless overridden by, e.g., a `-d` flag) for cases when student is working on a program in their home directory.

items.title: How to unable check50 and submit50?
items.body:
This may be a ridiculously simple question, I apologize beforehand.

I started cs50 on edX two days ago but just couldn't figure out how to run check50 and submit50. 
1) tried cs50.me. 
Result: page jumped to authentication page, but the button for authentication is light green/grey and cannot be clicked.
2) tried SSH
Result: all set, added SSH to github and ran code on cloud terminal, but when trying to run submit50 for pset1, it still said account not authenticated.
3) tried to switch from a private workspace to a public one.
Result: fails, account not authenticated when trying to submit hello.c

What exactly is the way to authenticate submit50 and check50? 
Thank you!

items.title: augment comments throughout code
add -u/--user flag that specifies username to use for SSH submissions
items.body: Use case is so that lab50 can have `bot50` submit on a student's behalf. Could just use raw `git` commands for such, but then `!exclude` and such wouldn't be respected. Might also be helpful for more-comfy users who have SSH keys associated with multiple GitHub accounts?

items.title: rename "slug" to "branch"
items.body: Might as well adopt a word students and teachers will see elsewhere?

items.title: changed github username, all submissions deleted
items.body: I changed my github username from dpett122 to dpett and mayhem has ensued. I don't want to mess up and delete all of my submissions. Step-by-step instructions on how to migrate from the old username to the new one would be greatly appreciated.

items.title: remove code that generates personal access token, instead prompt for "Personal Access Token: " instead of "GitHub Password: " if 2FA enabled
filenames with non-UTF-8 characters trigger a UnicodeDecodeError
items.body: Filenames with non-UTF-8 characters trigger a UnicodeDecodeError: ``` ~/workspace/pset4/recover/ $ submit50 cs50/2018/x/recover --verbose Connecting... Authenticating... git config --global credential.https://github.com/submit50.username git credential-cache --socket /home/ubuntu/.git-credential-cache/submit50 exit git -c credential.helper='cache --socket /home/ubuntu/.git-credential-cache/submit50 --timeout 604800' -c credentialcache.ignoresighup=true credential approve Preparing... git clone --bare https://username@github.com/submit50/username /tmp/tmp2o8vlje5 Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/tmp2o8vlje5'... Password for 'https://username@github.com': remote: Counting objects: 220, done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done. remote: Total 220 (delta 0), reused 3 (delta 0), pack-reused 217 Receiving objects: 100% (220/220), 5.24 MiB | 5.09 MiB/s, done. Resolving deltas: 100% (87/87), done. git checkout --force cs50/2018/x/recover .gitattributes error: pathspec '.gitattributes' did not match any file(s) known to git. git config user.email username@users.noreply.github.com git config user.name username git symbolic-ref HEAD refs/heads/cs50/2018/x/recover git config core.excludesFile /tmp/tmpyxoz26th git add --all git ls-files recover.c git ls-files --exclude-from=/tmp/tmp2o8vlje5/info/exclude --other "AWA\211\377AVI\211\366AUI\211\325ATL\215%\200\361 " card.raw recover Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/bin/submit50", line 11, in load_entry_point('submit50==2.4.7', 'console_scripts', 'submit50')() File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/submit50.py", line 128, in main submit("submit50", args["slug"]) File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/submit50.py", line 581, in submit others = [unescape(other) for other in others] File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/submit50.py", line 581, in others = [unescape(other) for other in others] File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/submit50.py", line 577, in unescape .decode("utf8") UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0x89 in position 3: invalid start byte Sorry, something's wrong! Let sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know! git credential-cache --socket /home/ubuntu/.git-credential-cache/submit50 exit Submission cancelled. ``` Reproduce with `python3` at the command line with: ``` >>> s = "AWA\211\377AVI\211\366AUI\211\325ATL\215%\200\361 " >>> s.encode('latin1').decode('unicode-escape').encode('latin1').decode('utf8') Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0x89 in position 3: invalid start byte ``` Results from https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/develop/submit50.py#L564-L581, which is inspired by https://stackoverflow.com/a/46650050/5156190. Goal of those lines is to display the filenames, when summarizing files to be submitted and not submitted, just as the students see them in their directory (as via `ls`), so that they recognize them: I.e., as: Instead of as: We could pass `-z` to `git-ls-files`, to avoid `git`'s escaping of Unicode characters. But then [`spawnu`](http://pexpect.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/pexpect.html#handling-unicode) tends to choke, since it needs to know the encoding of the characters it's seeing (and doesn't like unrecognized encodings, as might happen with accidentally created filenames). Perhaps worth noting is how `zip` and `tar` handle this anomalous filename: ``` ~/workspace/pset4/ $ zip -r recover.zip recover/ adding: recover/ (stored 0%) adding: recover/recover.c (deflated 61%) adding: recover/recover (deflated 62%) adding: recover/AWAAVIAUITL% (stored 0%) ~/workspace/pset4/ $ tar cvf recover.tar recover recover/ recover/recover.c recover/recover recover/AWA\211\377AVI\211\366AUI\211\325ATL\215%\200\361 ```

items.title: blacklist .~c9_invoke_*
when required files are missing, tell user which directory they're actually in, ask if they intended another
subsequent submission fails when large file is removed
items.body:
Assumes https://git-lfs.github.com/ is installed.

If a student submits a large file (e.g., `101.bin`) and then re-submits their work with that file removed and perhaps another big file added (e.g., `102.bin`), the second submission fails because `101.bin` is not actually checked out, since we do a bare clone (to avoid downloading files unnecessarily). Symptom is avoided by adding `--no-verify` to the subsequent push, but that seems to disable Git LFS's pre-push hook altogether, which probably isn't ideal. 

# simulates first submission

```
$ mkdir ~/git_work_tree1

$ cd ~/git_work_tree1

$ git init

$ git remote add origin git@github.com:cs50/lfs-demo.git

$ git lfs install --local
Updated git hooks.
Git LFS initialized.

$ dd if=/dev/zero of=1.bin bs=1M count=1
1+0 records in
1+0 records out
1048576 bytes (1.0 MB) copied, 0.00128985 s, 813 MB/s

$ dd if=/dev/zero of=101.bin bs=101M count=1
1+0 records in
1+0 records out
105906176 bytes (106 MB) copied, 0.106539 s, 994 MB/s

$ git lfs track 101.bin
Tracking "101.bin"

$ git add 1.bin 101.bin .gitattributes

$ git commit -m 1
[master (root-commit) a54e5d7] 1
 3 files changed, 4 insertions(+)
 create mode 100644 .gitattributes
 create mode 100644 1.bin
 create mode 100644 101.bin

$ git push -u origin master
Git LFS: (1 of 1 files) 101.00 MB / 101.00 MB                                                                                                             
Counting objects: 5, done.
Delta compression using up to 12 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
Writing objects: 100% (5/5), 1.44 KiB | 184.00 KiB/s, done.
Total 5 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
To github.com:cs50/lfs-demo.git
 * [new branch]      master -> master
Branch master set up to track remote branch master from origin.
```

# simulates second submission, wherein `101.bin` is deleted

```
$ mkdir ~/git_dir2

$ cd ~/git_dir2

$ git clone --bare git@github.com:cs50/lfs-demo.git .

$ mkdir ~/git_work_tree2

$ cd ~/git_work_tree2

$ cp ~/git_work_tree1/{1,101}.bin .

$ rm -f 101.bin

$ dd if=/dev/zero of=102.bin bs=102M count=1
1+0 records in
1+0 records out
106954752 bytes (107 MB) copied, 0.103203 s, 1.0 GB/s

$ GIT_DIR=~/git_dir2 GIT_WORK_TREE=. git checkout --force master .gitattributes

$ GIT_DIR=~/git_dir2 GIT_WORK_TREE=. git lfs track 102.bin
Tracking "102.bin"

$ GIT_DIR=~/git_dir2 GIT_WORK_TREE=. git add --all

$ GIT_DIR=~/git_dir2 GIT_WORK_TREE=. git commit -m 2
[master 936cff5] 2
 3 files changed, 4 insertions(+), 3 deletions(-)
 delete mode 100644 101.bin
 create mode 100644 102.bin

$ GIT_DIR=~/git_dir2 GIT_WORK_TREE=. git push origin master
open /home/ubuntu/git_work_tree2/101.bin: no such file or directory
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@github.com:cs50/lfs-demo.git'
```

items.title: submit50 and check50 aren`t working
items.body:
Hi,

I don`t know whether it`s a bug or I`m just doing smth wrong with updates, but I can`t submit and check my code after update50. Here the text of mistake:

> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/bin/submit50", line 6, in <module>
>     from pkg_resources import load_entry_point
>   File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1479, in <module>
>     register_loader_type(importlib_bootstrap.SourceFileLoader, DefaultProvider)
> AttributeError: module 'importlib._bootstrap' has no attribute 'SourceFileLoader'

items.title: factor out yes/no for internationalization
errs when file being submitted has space
hangs when credential.https://github.com/submit50.username is set but password is not in ssh-agent
add command-line argument to clear credential cache
Remove dependency on `except:` and `except Exception` where possible
items.body: It is much better python style to be specific about the errors you expect. Additionally, `except:` can lead to us catching exceptions we don't want to be catching.

items.title: hide credential-related comments from verbose mode?
items.body: Not enlightening for a student who wants to understand how we're adding, committing, and pushing.

items.title: don't use SSH mode if user has passphrase and no ssh-agent
EOFErrors upon ctrl-d at prompts
SSH Authentication hangs if ssh key needs to be unlocked
missing a few translations
items.body: https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/ctrl-d/locale/es/LC_MESSAGES/messages.po#L112-L157

items.title: hangs on Mac OS 10.12.5 with Python 2.7.10 and pexpect 4.2.1
items.body:
```
python submit50.py 2017/x/hello -v
Connecting...
Authenticating...
git config --global credential.https://github.com/submit50.username
git -c credential.helper='cache --socket /Users/jharvard/.git-credential-cache/submit50' credential fill
```

If you change

```py
    # check cache, then config for credentials
    credentials = run("git -c credential.helper='cache --socket {}' credential fill".format(authenticate.SOCKET),
                      lines=[""]*3,
                      quiet=True)
```

to

```py
    # check cache, then config for credentials
    credentials = run("git -c credential.helper='cache --socket {}' credential fill".format(authenticate.SOCKET),
                      lines=[""]*3,
                      quiet=False)
```

then output is:

```
Connecting...
Authenticating...
git config --global credential.https://github.com/submit50.username
git -c credential.helper='cache --socket /Users/jharvard/.git-credential-cache/submit50' credential fill


Username: 
Password:
```

Might be related to password prompting, per https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/credential.c.

items.title: error: too few arguments
if user types char then hits DEL at honesty prompt, whole line disappears
eliminate submit.EXCLUDE, as by moving contents to $GIT_DIR/info/exclude
items.body: Since right now, `submit.ATTRIBUTES` and `submit.EXCLUDE` are used quite differently, and latter can just be moved to `$GIT_DIR/info/exclude`.

items.title: tidy authenticate.SOCKET, as by adding a helper function that expires cache
internationalize client
fix style per PEP
change call to bindtextdomain to find `locale` dir based on where package gets installed
items.body:
If `submit50` gets installed by `pip` in, e.g., `/opt/pyenv/shims/submit50`, where will `locale` end up? Can we locate it dynamically so that we can still test during dev by running `python submit50.py`?

https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/gettext/submit50.py#L37

items.title: clear credential cache when user hits ctrl-c
items.body: Else if user is cached, can't submit under different username without manually deleting cache.

items.title: on Mac OS, install certs
items.body:
Because of https://bugs.python.org/issue29065, pseudocode for `setup.py`:

```
if Mac OS and Sierra and Python 3.6 and command exists:
    /Applications/Python 3.6/Install Certificates.command
```

Per @brianyu28.

items.title: add support for SSH authentication
items.body:
- Require user to store username in `~/.gitconfig`.
- Require user to add SSH key to GitHub account.
- When `authenticate()` is called, try an authenticated git command using repo's `ssh://` URL first. If failure, fall back on password.

items.title: change setup.py to use console_scripts
items.body: http://python-packaging.readthedocs.io/en/latest/command-line-scripts.html#the-console-scripts-entry-point

items.title: have submit50 autoupdate via pip and also check cs50.me for latest version
items.body: Now that `submit50` is on PyPi, would this be more elegant? Instead of autoupdate, could just ask user to update? Bad to rely on `pip`?

items.title: fix spinner
items.body: Probably shouldn't do `spin(False)` in so many places, as creates situations where `stdout` is temporarily blank.

items.title: _GetchUnix doesn't let ctrl-c trigger SIGINT at password prompt
Could not find a suitable TLS CA certificate bundle
items.body:
In CS50 CLI, `submit50` works okay after installing dependencies manually via `pip`, but not via `python setup.py develop`, per below.

items.title: remove hard-coded references to submit50 throughout?
eliminate API call that checks for repo as unnecessary
items.body:
We can probably just clone and check for failure?

https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/develop/submit50#L268-L271

items.title: tweak authenticate() to use credential cache
items.body:
When cloning repo, probably need to run `git config credential.helper cache`. To get cached credentials, can do `git credential fill\n\n`, though not sure if repo already needs to exist locally (as it did in our tests).

# references
* https://git-scm.com/docs/git-credential-cache
* https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Credential-Storage

items.title: check code for PEP compliance
check for "problem" arg, not [0]
items.body: https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/develop/submit50#L78-L79

items.title: easy way to install dependencies in dev environments
items.body:
Rather than having to install the package itself, is there a simple way to install

```
"getch", "pexpect>=4.0", "requests", "termcolor"
```

in dev environments, in a manner akin to `pip install -r requirements`?

items.title: when doing local dev (e.g., in cli50), can't run ./submit50 without package itself being installed
items.body:
```
$ ../submit50 test
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "../submit50", line 31, in <module>
    __version__ = get_distribution("submit50").version
  File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 557, in get_distribution
    dist = get_provider(dist)
  File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 431, in get_provider
    return working_set.find(moduleOrReq) or require(str(moduleOrReq))[0]
  File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 967, in require
    needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements))
  File "/opt/pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 853, in resolve
    raise DistributionNotFound(req, requirers)
pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: The 'submit50' distribution was not found and is required by the application
```

items.title: columns is 0 when redirecting output
items.body:
Looks like [`columns`](https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/1e122e51105ef02eff8d2de4db6939e538942175/submit50#L243) is `0` if you redirect output, which causes an exception per https://travis-ci.org/cs50/submit50/jobs/238360420#L479

```
$ submit50 --help > foo
Error in sys.excepthook:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 266, in excepthook
    cprint("Sorry, something's wrong! Let sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know!", "yellow")
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 254, in cprint
    termcolor.cprint(textwrap.fill(text, columns), color=color, on_color=on_color, attrs=attrs, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 377, in fill
    return w.fill(text)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 349, in fill
    return "\n".join(self.wrap(text))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 340, in wrap
    return self._wrap_chunks(chunks)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 234, in _wrap_chunks
    raise ValueError("invalid width %r (must be > 0)" % self.width)
ValueError: invalid width 0 (must be > 0)

Original exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/kareem/.virtualenvs/submit50/bin/submit50", line 6, in <module>
    exec(compile(open(__file__).read(), __file__, 'exec'))
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 524, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 90, in main
    usage()
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 485, in usage
    cprint("Usage: submit50 problem")
  File "/home/kareem/github/cs50/submit50/submit50", line 254, in cprint
    termcolor.cprint(textwrap.fill(text, columns), color=color, on_color=on_color, attrs=attrs, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 377, in fill
    return w.fill(text)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 349, in fill
    return "\n".join(self.wrap(text))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 340, in wrap
    return self._wrap_chunks(chunks)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/textwrap.py", line 234, in _wrap_chunks
    raise ValueError("invalid width %r (must be > 0)" % self.width)
ValueError: invalid width 0 (must be > 0)
```

Perhaps we shouldn't rely on `get_terminal_size`'s fallback value and just hard-code `column or 80`?

items.title: remove --checkout as no longer needed
display files for submission in tree format?
use git-lfs (if installed) for files > 100MB
items.body: Per https://help.github.com/articles/conditions-for-large-files/.

items.title: should we be calling pexpect.run directly?
items.body: In https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/master/submit50#L211, we call `pexpect.run` directly, but should that be a call to our own `run` method? To facilitate such, do we need to change `run` to return not only `command_output` but a `statuscode`?

items.title: HTTP errors being shown in non-verbose mode
items.body:
```
~/workspace/pset3/find/ $ submit50 find
HTTP Error 404: Not Found
Invalid problem. Did you mean to submit something else?
Submission cancelled.
```

items.title: git add --all throws error on extra directory contents
items.body:
A CS50x user of `submit50-2.1.4` reported getting the "Something is wrong ..." error at the point where the script runs `git add --all`. He was submitting from a directory with several files unrelated to the problem being submitted. I was able to reproduce the error, as shown below. When I then removed the extraneous files, I was able to submit with no problem.
```
~/workspace/pset3/ $ submit50 --verbose 2017/x/find/less
GitHub username: glennholloway
GitHub password: ***********      
Authentication code: 600525
git clone --bare https://glennholloway@github.com/submit50/glennholloway /tmp/tmpmdp22r_1
Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/tmpmdp22r_1'...
Password for 'https://glennholloway@github.com': 
remote: Counting objects: 52, done.        
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.        
remote: Total 52 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 49        
Unpacking objects: 100% (52/52), done.
Checking connectivity... done.
git config user.email glennholloway@users.noreply.github.com
git config user.name glennholloway
git symbolic-ref HEAD refs/heads/cs50/2017/x/find/less
git config core.excludesFile /tmp/tmphfx347xy
git config core.ignorecase true
git add --all
  File "/opt/cs50/bin/submit50", line 465, in <module>
    main()
  File "/opt/cs50/bin/submit50", line 89, in main
    submit(args["args"][0])
  File "/opt/cs50/bin/submit50", line 228, in submit
    run("git add --all")
  File "/opt/cs50/bin/submit50", line 401, in run
    raise Error()
Sorry, something's wrong! Let sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know!
Submission cancelled.
~/workspace/pset3/ $ version50
98
~/workspace/pset3/ $ ls -a
./   Makefile   caesar.c   find.c    generate.c    helpers.c  makefile
../  Untitled1  fifteen.c  generate  helpers.[hc]  helpers.h
~/workspace/pset3/ $ 
```

items.title: support python 2
items.body:
Right now, this package requires `getch`, which is for Python 3+, and the `submit50`script uses Python-3-specific features like [`raise ... from`](https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/0dcd808ae0b7a694920cd0952e4be6289cd61b49/opt/cs50/submit50/bin/submit50.py#L50). There's [`getch-1.0-python2.tar.gz`](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/getch#downloads), which is `getch` for Python 2. So if we can get this to install on systems running Python 2, and `getch` to install on systems running Python 3+, any idea whether it'd be feasible to get `submit50` to support Python 2 as well, @brianyu28?

cc @dmalan

```
    password=password)
  File "../submit50.py", line 395, in run
    raise Error()
Sorry, something's wrong! Let sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know!
Submission cancelled.
```

items.title: only print "Submission cancelled" if actually run in submit mode
items.body: Right now, that might happen even with `--checkout` or, if ctrl-c is hit quickly enough, `--help`.

items.body:
From:

```
Submitted cs50/2017/x/hello! See ...
```

to:

```
Submitted 2017/x/hello! See ...
```

items.body:
Using `cprint` would shorten some lines? 

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/termcolor

items.title: change success message to provide deep link on cs50.me
items.body:
Instead of just, e.g.,

```
Submitted cs50/2017/x/hello! See https://cs50.me/.
```

can we append the full path to https://cs50.me/?

items.title: Fails, then succeeds on same input
items.body:
In release 96 of `ide50`, I ran `submit50` twice in rapid succession, changing nothing between the two runs. The first failed, but the second succeeded.

    ~/workspace/pset1/ $ submit50 2017/spring/hello
    GitHub username: glennholloway
    GitHub password: ***********
    Authentication Code: 508866
    Looks like we haven't enabled submit50 for your account yet! Let sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know your GitHub username!
    Submission cancelled.
    ~/workspace/pset1/ $ submit50 2017/spring/hello
    GitHub username: glennholloway
    GitHub password: ***********
    Authentication Code: 215120
    Files that will be submitted:
     hello.c
    Keeping in mind the course's policy on academic honesty, are you sure you want to submit these files? yes
    Submitted cs50/2017/spring/hello! See https://github.com/submit50/glennholloway/tree/cs50/2017/spring/hello.
    ~/workspace/pset1/ $

items.title: change # symbol in exclude files to mean "require" not "recommend"
allow staff to specify required directories in exclude files too
items.body:
E.g., in https://github.com/submit50/submit50/blob/pset7/exclude, would be nice to add

```
#templates/
```

items.title: create VERSION file in submit50/submit50
items.body:
Am thinking we should have a `VERSION` file in `submit50/submit50` that specifies the minimum version number that a user must be using at the command line, in case we change server-side options.

Or this can become part of cs50.me.

items.title: replace submit50/submit50's branches with just one config file on master
items.body:
It's already becoming a bit unmaintainable having one branch per `exclude` file. And easy to make a mistake, as by pushing to wrong remote branch. Am thinking we should just replace all of our branches with an `exclude/` directory on the `master` branch of `submit50/submit50`, inside of which is `foo`, `bar`, `baz`, etc., where each of `foo`, `bar`, and `baz` are former branches' names (i.e., problems).

Or, instead of using `submit50/submit50` in this way, we could bake supported problems (i.e., repo names) into cs50.me, so that the `submit50` CLI instead contacts cs50.me, though that somewhat breaks the abstraction barrier.

items.title: update dependencies
items.body:
In https://github.com/cs50/submit50/blob/master/Makefile:

* add `python3`
* remove `expect`, `jq`, `util-linux` (I think last is safe to remove now)

Can the Python dependencies in `requirements.txt` be installed as `apt-get` dependencies? E.g., for dependency `foo`, does `python3-foo` exist, so we can avoid calling `pip3` in `after-install.sh`, per http://askubuntu.com/questions/327543/how-can-a-debian-package-install-python-modules-from-pypi?

Either way, `requirements.txt` shouldn't end up in `bin`. Ideally should be integrated into `Makefile` or `after-install.sh`.

items.title: support empty exclude files
items.body: whereby https://raw.githubusercontent.com/submit50/submit50/$problem/exclude exists but has no lines

items.title: remove github3 dependency
items.body: Seems no longer needed.

items.title: Minor line break issue
items.body:
Super minor but if you type in the wrong username/password, the program tries to print a two line error message, but the `\n` gets interpreted literally: 

```
Sorry, something's wrong!\nLet sysadmins@cs50.harvard.edu know!
```

I think this is just an `echo` issue. I'm pretty sure `echo` doesn't really like line breaks, so maybe use `printf` instead to fix this?

items.title: GitHub Releases not split up if there are extra .c files
items.body:
See the following submit50 repos for examples of this happening for pset2:

It seems that if there is some extra `.c` file that the problems are not properly divided, and instead all the files are all put into every release.

items.title: Not a git repository
items.body:
When I resubmit multiple times, every other time I get

```
git clone --bare https://github.com/submit50/kzidane
spawn git clone --bare https://kzidane@github.com/submit50/kzidane /tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB
Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB'...
error: could not lock config file /tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB/config: No such file or directory
error: could not lock config file /tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB/config: No such file or directory
fatal: Not a git repository: '/tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB'
error: could not lock config file /tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB/config: No such file or directory
error: could not lock config file /tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB/config: No such file or directory
git add --all
fatal: Not a git repository: '/tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB'
fatal: Not a git repository: '/tmp/tmp.QXoW0jiDQB'
None of the files in this directory are expected for submission.
Submission cancelled.
```

So for example, first try succeeds, second try fails with a log similar to the one above, third try succeeds (even if I don't touch anything — just e.g., `submit50 mario` again), and so on.

items.title: look for trailing / in exclude file to check for -d versus -f instead of -e
factor out red/yellow/green-printing into color-specific functions
detect when GitHub email address isn't verified
items.body: `git push` appears to return HTTP 403 in such cases.

items.title: check return values of git commands, fail gracefully on error
remove diagnostic output, replacing with user-friendly messages
items.body: Only show raw output of `run` commands when `submit50` is run with `--verbose` or `-v`.

items.title: show different URL upon successful submission
items.body:
Instead of

`https://github.com/submit50/$username/releases/tag/$problem`

show

`https://github.com/submit50/$username/tree/$problem`

unless post-commit hook is able to update `body` of release quickly enough for former to be more useful.
